reviewText:
I'm not a big fan of racing games usually, but this game is fantastic. Reminds me of the old Twisted Metal games for Playstation. It's a solid racing game but with tons of action, explosions, and even zombies. I was just going to play it for a little bit to kill some time, and I ended up getting hooked on it.

The positives are the gameplay, difficulty, and visuals. The game is exciting, with guns and explosions and a few jumps. Quite satisfying. The game can get very difficult on the higher difficulty settings, which provides a great challenge. The visuals are probably the strongest aspect of this game. Very gritty, but at the same time flashy and over-the-top. Overall, it's a very gratifying experience.

The downside is that there is pretty much no choice at all in terms of cars and equipment. Each new car is basically a complete upgrade of the previous car, so there's no strategy or preference at all. The best car is just the best car for everything. All upgrades can be bought, and there's no need to design anything. You just choose the best car with all upgrades, and that's the best. Would be nice to see slower heavy cars that are better for battle, or super fast cars that get wrecked easily.

reviewText:
Although it stumbles here and there, and the online servers being more or less deserted at this point, Gas Guzzlers Extreme is still a fantastically fun game. It blends arcady racing and vehicular combat incredibly well, and has plenty of content whether you come at it for the competitive and team-based multiplayer, or the singleplayer campaign that is perfectly paced with enough carrots to keep you interested throughout the 10-ish hours it will take to complete.

4/5

I've found this game to be pretty fun and funny.

reviewText:
It is really good game and I enjoyed it.
I've completed singleplayer mode and here what I think.
There are minuses:
1) I don't like the engine, it is really wooden and sometimes unraceble.
2) I don't like some tracks, they are making me angry, because I don't even see where to drive,  especialy rainy tracks, I've completed them by driving along the border and turning nitro (bad engine).
Desert tracks have a lot of stuff so you can't see where are you driving (mini-map is no use here, because if you start looking at it, you'll definitely hit the wall).
3) Almost all weapons are no use. My best choise is double-sided minigun, and there is no better weapon (sadly).
4) I hate LAST MAN STANDING, because when there is only two players left the game can lasts forever.
5) Stupid AI.

Anyway, If there will be more racing tracks and better engine it would be really awesome game.
I got my fun, I like this game, I haven't tried multiplayer yet, I think it's better then singleplayer.
I hope this game will develop further.

reviewText:
I didnt have big hopes for this game as most games bought today are more of the same stuff with different cars and tracks. Nothing bad about that but no new wooov experience. Anywy back to this game, short story.  2 Words: Mad Max and Death Race on steroids :)

Depending on what type of race you choose you will be able to upgrade parts such as engine, brakes, tires and more. And if not satisfied buy yourself a new unlocked car. And the cosmetic yup its here as well. Paint your car, put on bought stripes, paintbrush stickers and why not some new shiny rimes  ;) The car handling and physix is spot on in this game. Love it. The feeling when you accelrate feels down to your bones.

Campaign: Choose your car and upgrade it with the money you have in the begining. (Dont worrie you will earn alot more as you progress and unlock more stuff.) After that you are being showed a screen where you can pick your favourite type of race. You will progress in a leaderboard up to the top. And you will unlock more cars, parts, stripes, wepons and more depending how you beat the maps placing 1st,2nd or 3rd place.

In campaign you will also get sponsor contracts where you can earn some big cash and drive their sponsored car. You can also unlock sponsor car skins wich will give you some extra cash if you use them and win any race.

Quickrace: Here you can choose Car combat, Normal race, Destruction derby, Last man standing or why not zombie mode one hell of fun if you ask me. Take some friends with you for a game and you will have a blast. Iam getting this for my son thats for sure. Love it. (There are more gamemodes in the game, the above is an example.) One last thing quickrace is awesome for killing some time. In my case i have been playing quickrace destruction derby, defend base and survivor zombies for hours already. ;)

Multiplayer: Is the same pure fun as singleplayer but with real people online ;)

Gfx 10-10 (The quality of textures, animations and physix's is midblowing)
SFx 9-10 (Sfx and music is fitting the game perfectly)
Gameplay 10-10 (The car handling is one of the best i have experienced in the arcade genre)

I have been trying to look for some flaws but couldnt find anything wrong with this game. My new gem in my collection for sure. I would recommend developer to have this game as free weekend, i can promise that most of all new players who didnt have a clue about this game will buy it. RECOMMENDED FOR SURE!

Please note! That zombie mode is bought as DLC and i would recommend buying all DLC. Worth every ¬£ $ ‚Ç¨  ;)

reviewText:
This is a great game, a hidden gem. I wasn't expecting modes like TDM, CTF, etc... in a game like this, but it works. In race modes, there is another way to win - destroying everyone else, and it is fun. It takes a little bit time to get used to the game, because you are not only there to race, but also to fend for yourself.

Graphics, sounds, music are all alright. You can choose to run the game in 64bit if you desire. Gamepad is fully supported. Car customization is not the best, as you mostly deal with internals, but it is sufficient. Just don't expect NFS Underground II levels of customization!

Sad to see there is little to no multiplayer action though. I guess it is due to the amount of time passed, and maybe as people consider this genre a niche for some reason. But I can only imagine this game being even more fun with real people, especially friends. But I still have fun playing the Campaign mode to be honest.

Also, when you crash someone, you get the middle finger. Overall, I recommend this game to anyone who are into car battle" or racing games. As I've said

reviewText:
While the concept of the game is nothing new, it has definitely been brought up to modern times. Lots of humor brought into the game, be it computer player names, or the included voice packs. (Hail to the King, Baby!) Also, why wouldn't you want a game that includes a Reliant Robin look-alike!

It's an amazing arcade racer, with the expected handling and control that you'd expect from such. Think Burnout Paradise, but now you have shotguns/miniguns/RPGs/grenade launchers/railguns/nukes to blast the competitors out of your way. Power-ups are scattered around the race tracks, and can definitely help you catch up if you're behind, or to keep the competition in the dust.

While the game is a blast to play, it does quickly get repetitive, as there's only a dozen or less tracks for each mode, and that's not including when you drive the opposite direction. With exception of a few game modes, you're locked to your weapon of choice from your garage, or sponsor for the duration of the race, so make sure it fits your preferred style of destruction! In-game money does seem to be a very moot point, as you are rewarded with exuberant amounts (assuming you place first, and have the sponsor bonus cash), and upgrades honestly don't cost much, and only take a single race or two to be purchased. As for buying cars, by the time it's released to be purchased, you already have enough winnings to not even hesitate purchasing it, even with buying every upgrade for every vehicle as soon as it's available.

Game modes include:
Classic Race: No guns, no power-ups, but boost is included.
Power Race: No guns, but you do have power-ups. Driving skill of the track, and power-ups are the key to winning.
Battle Race: Same as above, only with your guns now.
Knockout Race: Same as battle, only the last player of each lap is eliminated, and the race continues until only one person remains. Taking out opponents can quicken that final lap, as they do not respawn. Neither do you either.
Deathmatch: Set in an open area, weapons are scattered around the playing field, and you can switch between the ones that you have collected during your current life. First to the set score wins.
Last Man Standing: Same as above, only you don't respawn.
Capture the Flag (Team): Also set in the same open arenas, there are two flags that need to be captured. Only one player from each team can take a flag, and in order to score, the flag holder needs to collect the second flag from the opposing team. First team to the set score wins.
Team Matches: Any of the above modes can have set teams, and the team that reaches the score, or highest ranking of the race wins.

Owning the Full Metal Frenzy DLC, the two vehicles are just plain remodels of two existing cars, with the same stats, handling, and performance. Dominator, Demolition Derby, and Domination Derby are great modes, but that is all the DLC brings, as Zagreb is very small, and the flags spawn in 2 of 4 places and alternate back and forth, unlike other maps that have several spawn points. The Cowboy arena is also very hilly, and hard to get your sights set, as well as for this arena, the computers are more prone to running away and hiding, rather than trying to fight you, sometimes forcing the clock to run down, as they boost from health pickup to health pickup.

All in all, it's a great fresh game, with great influences, pushing it in all the right directions, and steering away from poor decisions of it's inspirations. Grab the demo, enjoy it, then purchase it! I do recommend buying it when it goes on sale, as $10 is a fair price for this game, not $25, especially with how minimal the DLC bring, and their high price for what they include.

reviewText:
Basic InformationTitle: Gas Guzzlers Extreme
Genre: Action, Racing, Sports
Developer: Gamepires
Publisher: Iceberg Interactive
Release Date: 8 Oct, 2013

Basic OverviewThis is a very unique kind of racing games. When you play a normal racing game there isn't really that much excitment, it seems that every race is the same and gets kind of boring. Even though there are different tracks and such doesn't really keep me intrested. This game however keeps me intrested enough to play more than regualar racing games. So what is so different about this racing game than others? Guns. On this game you get guns on your cars!

Game PlayThe gameplay is fast and very furious. With mayhem that could happen at anytime during the races, from your car bashing into another or you shooting another car it really makes it satisfying enough to extend the playtime of this game for me anyways. There are multiple modes on this game which don't always require you to race other cars. Deathmatch mode is exactly what you would expect it to be. You and a few other cars get set with guns and you shoot each other with them, this also ties in with online mode, along with bots that you can go against as well. The game itself has so many modes that I can't really cover them all, just know that there will be a lot to do on this game to keep you entertained. The controls are tight, which is essintial for a game like this at a fast paced speed. There a few upgrades and car customization as you would expect in typical racing games as well.
Score (Out Of 10): 10 - Very nice replay value and destruction. Along with loads of game modes to keep you intrested

Graphics/Art StyleThe graphics of this game is beautiful. The cars themselves look amazing and relaistic, along with the terrain of the game, sky ect. The atmosphere of the game is really set by the graphics if you get what I mean. In some areas it feels really nice with the atmospheric graphics. With you being in the wasteland and all it feels like this is the right place to be shooting up other cars and destroying them.
Score (Out Of 10): 8 - Very nice graphics

Music & SoundsThe music is alright while racing around and shooting your friends (maybe now your enemies) as you try to avoid their line of fire from their weapons. The sounds of each of the weapons firing isn't really all that, as usual just the generic use of the guns shooting ect.
Score (Out Of 10): 6 - Would've liked some more music variety and sound variety

ConclusionFor the price of this game is pretty steep, but you will get a enjoyable gameing experience for it and would be very happy that you bought it.

reviewText:
While I had high hopes for this game, and it IS a pretty solid racer in its own right, but the multiplayer is a joke (multiplayer being the main reason to pick this up).

1.  There is no peer/client listen server option.  The only way to play a private match with your friends is to run your own dedicated server.  Yes, the devs believe it's 1998.

2.  The peak number of players in the WORLD at one time is 200-ish people, right after the Steam Xmas sale.  This will drop back down to a dozen on a busy day in a week.

3.  Even if you want to bother setting up a server, opening up ports, and MANUALLY GIVING YOUR FRIENDS THE IP TO CONNECT TO (that's right, it's a quakeserver!), there's no steamworks integration.  Seriously.

It's like the devs decided they wanted to make a game with zero future.

If you can get this for $2, it's worth it for the singleplayer, but not much more than that, as by the time you can pick it up at that price, there will be no one in the world playing (that's 2 weeks from now btw), but maybe you can sucker a few of your friends to pick it up and you can pretend it's the 90s again and feel the nostalgia of setting up and running an external dedicated server that you give the IP to your buddies to play for 15 minutes and then never play again.

Pretty sure we'll never see another game from this developer.  That's a good thing.
